properties.Name: TableOfGuaranteedValues
properties.Description: The amount of cash or forfeiture values due an insured who surrenders all or part of a cash value life Insurance policy.

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Columns.Name: NonforfeitureOptionTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Nonforfeiture Option.

Columns.Name: Date
Columns.Description: The as-of or effective date that the associated information is determined or reported.

Columns.Name: TaxableCashTaxableCashSurrenderValueAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of accumulated cash value exceeding the premiums paid - the difference of which is taxable.

Columns.Name: NonTaxableCashSurrenderValueAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of accumulated cash value exceeding the premiums paid - the difference of which is not taxable.

Columns.Name: AmountOfLifeInsuranceRetained
Columns.Description: The amount of life insurance retained after receiving the associated surrender cash values.

Columns.Name: LoanValue
Columns.Description: The amount of money an insured can borrow using the cash value of his life insurance policy as security.

Columns.Name: ReducedPaidUpInsuranceValue
Columns.Description:
The amount of reduced paid-up insurance as of the associated surrender valuation date.

The Reduced Paid-up Option allows the policyowner to take a paid-up policy for a reduced amount of insurance.   

The policyowner does not pay any more premiums but still retains some amount of life insurance.

Essentially the cash value is used as the premium for a single-premium whole life policy at a lesser face amount than the original policy.

The paid-up policy is the same kind as the original, but for a lesser amount of coverage (see relationship to Life Insurance Policy entities for this new policy).  

The new paid-up policy is computed as a single-premium policy at the attained-age rate.  
Any term insurance rider and disability or accidental death benefits from the original policy are excluded when the amount of paid-up life insurance is calculated.

Once the paid-up policy has been issued and is in effect, the new face value remains the same for the life of the policy, which builds cash values.

Columns.Name: ExtendedTermInsuranceValue
Columns.Description: The amount of continuing insurance purchased by the contract's cash value for as long a period of time as the contract's cash value allows.

Properties.Description: The amount of cash or forfeiture values due an insured who surrenders all or part of a cash value life Insurance policy.
